channel.title: How To: Install Flash Plugin for Firefox in a 64Bit Kernel
channel.description:
This tutorial/copy and paste was written using a Red-Hat based operating system. (Fedora, CentOS, etc)
[user@TUNDRA ~]$ sudo rpm -ivh http://linuxdownload.adobe.com/adobe-release/adobe-release-i386-1.0-1.noarch.rpm [user@TUNDRA ~]$ sudo rpm --import /etc/pki/rpm-gpg/RPM-GPG-KEY-adobe-linux [user@TUNDRA ~]$ mkdir -p /usr/lib/mozilla/plugins [user@TUNDRA ~]$ sudo yum install nspluginwrapper.{i386,x86_64} pulseaudio-lib.i386 [user@TUNDRA ~]$ sudo yum install flash-plugin [user@TUNDRA ~]$ mozilla-plugin-config -i -g -v
Restart Firefox; enjoy.

item.title: How To: Install Flash Plugin for Firefox in a 64Bit Kernel
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:7, topic:266264”][quote author=llib link=topic=351542.msg2701615#msg2701615 date=1236642667]

There’s no need for compiling it (at least not in arch, it’s in the repo there)

Step1. Am I on Arch 64 bit? yes? Move on to step 2

Step2. pacman -S flashplugin

yay
[/quote]Exactly All set up and ready for use with firefox[/quote]

Some mean distros don’t have flash in their repo’s. :<

Read full topic
item.source: How To: Install Flash Plugin for Firefox in a 64Bit Kernel

Speljohan:

item.source: How To: Install Flash Plugin for Firefox in a 64Bit Kernel

item.title: How To: Install Flash Plugin for Firefox in a 64Bit Kernel
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:4, topic:266264”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=351542.msg2699508#msg2699508 date=1236509229]

This tutorial/copy and paste was written using a Red-Hat based operating system. (Fedora, CentOS, etc)

[user@TUNDRA ~]$ sudo rpm -ivh http://linuxdownload.adobe.com/adobe-release/adobe-release-i386-1.0-1.noarch.rpm
[user@TUNDRA ~]$ sudo rpm --import /etc/pki/rpm-gpg/RPM-GPG-KEY-adobe-linux
[user@TUNDRA ~]$ mkdir -p /usr/lib/mozilla/plugins
[user@TUNDRA ~]$ sudo yum install nspluginwrapper.{i386,x86_64} pulseaudio-lib.i386
[user@TUNDRA ~]$ sudo yum install flash-plugin
[user@TUNDRA ~]$ mozilla-plugin-config -i -g -v

Restart Firefox; enjoy.
[/quote]Pretty much useless now cause a real flash plugin for 64-bit is released.

Good post anyway

This method still works, ;D . Also, some people have trouble (especially new Linux users) compiling tar balls, etc.[/quote]There’s no need for compiling it (at least not in arch, it’s in the repo there)

Read full topic
item.source: How To: Install Flash Plugin for Firefox in a 64Bit Kernel

item.title: How To: Install Flash Plugin for Firefox in a 64Bit Kernel
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:2, topic:266264”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=351542.msg2698908#msg2698908 date=1236471311]
This tutorial/copy and paste was written using a Red-Hat based operating system. (Fedora, CentOS, etc)

[user@TUNDRA ~]$ sudo rpm -ivh http://linuxdownload.adobe.com/adobe-release/adobe-release-i386-1.0-1.noarch.rpm
[user@TUNDRA ~]$ sudo rpm --import /etc/pki/rpm-gpg/RPM-GPG-KEY-adobe-linux
[user@TUNDRA ~]$ mkdir -p /usr/lib/mozilla/plugins
[user@TUNDRA ~]$ sudo yum install nspluginwrapper.{i386,x86_64} pulseaudio-lib.i386
[user@TUNDRA ~]$ sudo yum install flash-plugin
[user@TUNDRA ~]$ mozilla-plugin-config -i -g -v

Restart Firefox; enjoy.
[/quote]Pretty much useless now cause a real flash plugin for 64-bit is released.

Good post anyway :P[/quote]

This method still works, ;D . Also, some people have trouble (especially new Linux users) compiling tar balls, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: How To: Install Flash Plugin for Firefox in a 64Bit Kernel
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

wget http://download.macromedia.com/pub/labs/flashplayer10/libflashplayer-10.0.d20.7.linux-x86_64.so.tar.gz &&  ( [ -d ~/.mozilla/plugins ] || mkdir ~/.mozilla/plugins ) && tar zxvf libflashplayer*.tar.gz -C ~/.mozilla/plugins

Theres one that supports *.tar.gz a package

Read full topic
